title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
01:34 <abusenius> has quit  
03:39 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
04:00 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:24 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <sburjan> good morning  
09:41 <sburjan> tmortagne: did you had time to look at the re-index issue after restart ?  
09:42 <tmortagne> sburjan: good morning  
09:42 <tmortagne> I fixed t yesterday  
09:42 <tmortagne> \*it  
09:42 <sburjan> ok, so it only remains the slowness issue  
09:42 <sburjan> on my machine  
09:43 <sburjan> tmortagne: the latest snapshot is from yesterday.  Seems ci is in a bad state  
09:50 <tmortagne> anyone knows if it's expected to have watchlist not enabled by default ?  
09:50 <tmortagne> sburjan ?  
09:50 <sburjan> tmortagne, afaik the watchlist is enabled by default. also auto-watch of documents is enabled by default  
09:51 <tmortagne> I'm only talking about plain watchlist not autowatch  
09:51 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <tmortagne> I create a user, connect to it, go to my profile and I don't have any job associated to this user  
09:51 <tmortagne> which mean that I won't receive any mail  
09:52 <tmortagne> autowatch is doing it's job and I have a few documents in the list  
09:53 <tmortagne> sburjan: would be great if you could try it on your side  
09:54 <tmortagne> will download get a standard build in the mentime  
09:55 <tmortagne> s/mentime/meantime/  
09:55 <sburjan> so you create a user, login with the new user and go to your profile ?  
09:55 <tmortagne> yep  
09:55 <tmortagne> and go to watchlist tab  
09:56 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:56 <tmortagne> do you have any value for the first property ?  
09:56 <tmortagne> "notification" I think (I'm in french right now)  
09:57 <vmassol> watchlist is of by default AFAIK  
09:57 <vmassol> \*off  
09:58 <vmassol> as a user you need to specify what frequency you wish to get in your profile AFAIR  
09:58 <sburjan> tmortagne: I have no notifier set by default  
09:58 <sburjan> the option with no value  
09:58 <sburjan> and my "Automated Document Watching" set to Default  
09:58 <sburjan> afaik these are the normal values  
09:59 <tmortagne> sburjan: this mean the watchlist is disabled  
09:59 <vmassol> "tmortagne, afaik the watchlist is enabled by default". this is not a correct statement, it's off by default  
10:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: this does not look done on purpose to me since you can't disabled it when you set something  
10:01 <tmortagne> when you edit your profile you can't say "nothing" you have to choose one  
10:02 <tmortagne> hmm actually you can in the profile but not in object editor  
10:02 <tmortagne> that's weird  
10:02 <sburjan> tmortagne: you can say "nothing", I have that selected for the notifier field value  
10:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6907  
10:03 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes I just said you can in the profile  
10:03 <tmortagne> anyway you wanted user report here is one I got: "I added a few documents in my watchlist but never receive any mail for it" and I agree that having watchlist disabled by defaut is pretty bad  
10:04 <sburjan> tmortagne: afaik it has been like this since I remember  
10:04 <tmortagne> sburjan: does not make it right  
10:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: you can comment on the issue  
10:05 <vmassol> I definitely agree we need to make it simpler to use for users who wish to use it  
10:05 <sburjan> tmortagne: think that a vanilla wiki does not have e-mail settings to use a mail server. so it can't send e-mail out of the box. having this enabled by default will generate stacktraces from time to time because of this  
10:05 <vmassol> sburjan: that's different  
10:06 <sburjan> why is it different ?  
10:06 <vmassol> because obviously the watchlist feature need to verify that the settings are correct for it to work  
10:06 <vmassol> if it doesn't it's a bug  
10:08 <sburjan> so the watchlists should verify if the e-mail config is properly set before trying to send e-mails ?  
10:09 <vmassol> not the wtachlist  
10:09 <vmassol> but the mail sender yes  
10:09 <sburjan> ok, I understand your POV. makes sense  
10:09 <vmassol> and percolate that to the watchlist  
10:10 <tmortagne> sburjan: this is not relevant, nothing prevent user from enabling the watchlist when mail is not properly configured  
10:10 <sburjan> true  
10:13 <msmeria> tmortagne: I get this: http://pastebin.com/P35WyyPU when I import the UI xar on the latest 5.1-snap  
10:14 <msmeria> I'm on manager/tomcat/hsqldb  
10:14 <tmortagne> msmeria: I have nothing at SolrIndexEventListener.java:138 so it doe snot looks like the latest  
10:15 <tmortagne> if the code did not moved too much it sounds like an attachment event has been send and there is no corresponding attachment  
10:17 <tmortagne> msmeria: I may have an idea why  
10:17 <tmortagne> looking at it  
10:17 <msmeria> tmortagne: ok  
10:18 <msmeria> the import works fine, but whenever I see a stack I can't ignore it :)  
10:19 <tmortagne> msmeria: and you are right  
10:19 <vmassol> that"s what they are made for :)  
10:19 <vmassol> (to not be ignored)  
10:23 <tmortagne> msmeria: should be fixed now  
10:24 <tmortagne> (if you know how to reproduce all the time)  
10:24 <msmeria> tmortagne: ok. in the meantime I reproduced the slowness of Solr indexing. Sorin told you about yesterday  
10:26 <tmortagne> msmeria: I have no idea what we can do about it, there is not much happening in XWiki side, 99% of the work is loading the document from the DB and Solr saving it in its lucene index on the filesystem  
10:27 <sburjan> I think XWiki's requirements spiked lately. On a regular computer, we have serious performance issues  
10:31 <tmortagne> vmassol: I think http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform%20Quality%20Checks/574/console is for you, sounds related to your rendering test framework refactoring  
10:33 <vmassol> cheking  
10:37 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:38 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: working fine locally, digging  
10:49 <vmassol> actually I won't have the time, I have to leave in 5 minutes  
10:50 <vmassol> I'm travelling to Luxembourg starting in a few minutes to do a live recording of LCC at the YAJUG  
10:50 <vmassol> so I won't be much available today unfortunately  
10:50 <vmassol> I'm back tomorrow around noon  
10:55 <vmassol> has quit  
11:04 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <msmeria> tmortagne: I tested XWIKI-9280 with a doc that has both en and fr translations. when I search with fr as current language I get one result; with en as current laguage I get 2 results. is that the intended behaviour ?  
11:25 <tmortagne> msmeria: depend what result you get  
11:25 <tmortagne> and you did not undertood XWIKI-9280  
11:25 <tmortagne> the point of XWIKI-9280  if you get a result in french when there is no french translation of the document  
11:26 <tmortagne> because when you go to the document you will see something even if there is no french translation  
11:26 <msmeria> tmortagne: can you give me a small "steps to reproduce" tutorial so I can test it ?  
11:29 <msmeria> I gtg now. we'll talk later  
11:30 <tmortagne> msmeria: adde detaild to the issue  
11:30 <tmortagne> \*added  
12:20 <msmeria> tmortagne: thanks  
12:33 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:33 <npm> has quit  
12:38 <msmeria> tmortagne: I found the doc when I searched for it in the last step: "search fr that document -> you don't find anything because that's an english document and Solr search UI search for french document only by default"  
12:38 <tmortagne> msmeria: then it means it's working  
12:39 <tmortagne> not finding the document is the old behavior  
12:41 <msmeria> tmortagne: ok. I missunderstood then. bug approved as fixed by the QA team :P  
12:41 <tmortagne> msmeria: I tough the following was clear about what we want  
12:41 <tmortagne> in the description of an issue you are supposed to indicate what is wrong  
12:44 <msmeria> I know. I just thought you were going to write a "special" step-by-step for me with the "fixed" behaviour  
12:44 <msmeria> dunno why  
12:54 <sburjan> tmortagne: I am on  the latest jetty hsqldb build and I still can't find default documents. is this normal ?  
12:56 <msmeria> you can't find the default docs and if you trigger indexing it looks like it's going to take an hour, at least on our PCs  
13:00 <msmeria> ok maybe not 1h, but ~ 15-20min and that's too high for ~ 500 docs  
13:26 <tmortagne> sburjan: did you waited a bit ?  
13:27 <tmortagne> also remember that most standard documents are hidden and you don't find hidden document by default  
13:27 <sburjan> tmortagne: 30 minutes till startup,  nothing found when searching for "\*".  Also, $services.solr.getQueueSize() reports 0  
13:27 <tmortagne> not \*  
13:28 <tmortagne> \*:\*  
13:29 <sburjan> same  
13:31 <tmortagne> sburjan: and you enabled hidden document in your user profile ?  
13:33 <sburjan> tmortagne: ok, I enabled explicitly. I was logged as Admin, I knew that for Admin  thedefault is to display, apparently it's not  
13:33 <sburjan> not I have 15 results  
13:33 <tmortagne> no it's not enabled b default even for Admin  
13:34 <tmortagne> 15 is still an issue, sounds like only the modified documents  
13:34 <tmortagne> not the initial documents  
13:34 <tmortagne> downloading latest snapshot  
13:36 <sburjan> wdym ? 15 is too little, ?  
13:36 <sburjan> most of them are \*Class documents  
13:42 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes I believe those 15 document are generated/updated document from Java and not existing documents  
13:43 <Denis> has quit  
13:43 <tmortagne> I found what is the issue, debug leftover...  
13:43 <tmortagne> it index only the first document in your version  
13:43 <sburjan> cool, another bug catched  
13:57 <mflorea> has quit  
13:59 <sburjan> tmortagne: any idea why we don't have new manager builds ? I see we had a enterprise build 3 hours ago .  
14:00 <sburjan> I see http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Manager/job/xwiki-manager/  
14:00 <sburjan> it states 2 may  
14:00 <sburjan> either I am looking in the wrong place, or I really don't know how to read CI  
14:04 <tmortagne> sburjan: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Manager/job/xwiki-manager/ does not see XE as a dependency so that's why  
14:05 <tmortagne> someone used xwiki-enterprise-feature-authorization-context as dependency which does not make any sense  
14:05 <tmortagne> fixing it...  
14:05 <sburjan> tmortagne: one thing I don't undersant. Which of the projects/jobs generates the war file used for manager ?  
14:05 <tmortagne> someone totally broke this job configuration, it's a mess  
14:06 <tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Manager/job/xwiki-manager/ build manager, I think it's pretty clear given it's name  
14:07 <sburjan> I still don't understand  
14:07 <sburjan> you triggered a job now  
14:07 <sburjan> but the last run dat was 2 may .. and we have manager-web 3-4 days old, so who generated those ?  
14:08 <sburjan> looking at http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-web/5.1-SNAPSHOT/  
14:09 <tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Manager/job/xwiki-manager-mysql/  
14:09 <tmortagne> you have two build of XEM  
14:09 <tmortagne> one to get hsqldb builds and the other to get mysql builds  
14:09 <tmortagne> the mysql one is pretty useless now IMO  
14:10 <tmortagne> removing it  
14:10 <sburjan> ok, but the wars I download have HSQLDB as default database in hibernate config.  
14:11 <tmortagne> sburjan: not it does not  
14:11 <tmortagne> it just has the default hibernate conf which happen to have hsqldb enabled by default  
14:12 <tmortagne> you don't have the hsqldb jar in that war  
14:12 <tmortagne> the database profile is not taken into account when building the war  
14:13 <sburjan> it's a mess in my head when regarding about CI. Do we have some page explaining the jobs, and what do each jobs produce on maven ?  
14:14 <tmortagne> the job just execute maven, you can look at each job configuration  
14:14 <tmortagne> I deleted the mysql one  
14:14 <sburjan> the jobs are the top horizontal menu from CI homepage ?  
14:15 <sburjan>   All Commons Dashboard Enterprise Functional Tests Manager Platform Rendering xwiki-portlet   
14:15 <tmortagne> the manager jobs do excatly the same thing as the enterprise jobs  
14:15 <tmortagne> if you understand XE you uderstand XEM  
14:15 <sburjan> ok, then let's try to understand enterprise first :)  
14:15 <sburjan> afaik managers is built on top of enterprise, right ?  
14:15 <tmortagne> got to one job and look at it's configuration  
14:18 <tmortagne> actually the simplest is to look at the job last build log  
14:18 <tmortagne> you will get the maven command  
14:19 <tmortagne> those jobs don't do anything more, they choose the right branch and execute maven  
14:19 <sburjan> my problem is that I don't know exactly whih are the builds and which are not :)  
14:20 <tmortagne> I don't understand  
14:20 <tmortagne> all the ci jobs are maven builds  
14:20 <sburjan> I know  
14:20 <tmortagne> some have test enable, some don't, some choose a specific branch etc  
14:20 <sburjan> but I can't read properly the interface. I don't know the interface. which this is what  
14:21 <tmortagne> which interface are you talking about ?  
14:21 <sburjan> the one from the browser.  
14:21 <tmortagne> what does not work ?  
14:22 <tmortagne> it's super slow but it works for me  
14:22 <sburjan> it works, it's ust that I don't understand the information from there  
14:22 <sburjan> for example:  
14:22 <sburjan> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Enterprise/  
14:22 <sburjan> this has 5 jobs ?  
14:22 <tmortagne> yes it has 5 jobs  
14:23 <msmeria> I can't create an app with AWM on the latest snapshot. I get a "Failed to execute the [velocity] macro" error when I click "Next Step" on step 2  
14:23 <sburjan> so basically we have a template job for enterprise, and we create new ones based on it with diferent parameters ?  
14:23 <sburjan> for 4.5.x, 5.0.x, and master ?  
14:23 <tmortagne> sburjan: you don't really care how we create the jobs  
14:23 <tmortagne> master is the default  
14:23 <tmortagne> default one  
14:24 <tmortagne> we don't repeat "master" that's all  
14:24 <tmortagne> since that's the default git branch  
14:24 <sburjan> yes  
14:24 <tmortagne> so you have here one build for each branch  
14:25 <tmortagne> the 3 important branches and some custom stuff that you probably don't care about  
14:25 <sburjan> ok, I see  
14:25 <tmortagne> but it's always the same thing in those 5 jobs  
14:25 <sburjan> so look at the top horizontal menu  
14:25 <tmortagne> xwiki-enterprise-feature-authorization-context  builds branch feature-authorization-context  
14:26 <sburjan> I see  
14:26 <sburjan> and I look at the top horizontal menu from http://ci.xwiki.org/  
14:27 <sburjan> and I see All Commons Contrib Dashboard Enterprise Functional Tests Manager Platform Rendering Watch XEclipse XOffice xwiki-portlet  
14:27 <tmortagne> and ?  
14:27 <sburjan> these are the top projects of XWiki ?  
14:27 <tmortagne> some are  
14:27 <tmortagne> "All" is obviously not a project name  
14:28 <tmortagne> same for "Dashboard" and "Functional Tests"  
14:28 <tmortagne> it's just jobs filters  
14:29 <tmortagne> but you don't have to master the whole jenkins to understand that manager build is in Manager  
14:29 <tmortagne> don't worry about all the possible tabs  
14:29 <sburjan> and in Jenkins terminology how are these called ?  
14:29 <tmortagne> just look at the ones you know  
14:29 <tmortagne> I don't understand the question  
14:30 <sburjan> ok, seems they are called Views  
14:30 <tmortagne> yes the tabs/filters are called views  
14:31 <sburjan> that was what I wanted to know  
14:31 <sburjan> gonna look at the master job from Enterprise  
14:41 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <vmassol> has quit  
15:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <msmeria> has quit  
15:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <mflorea> tmortagne: anything left to commit for 5.1RC1?  
15:20 <tmortagne> mflorea: yep I'm done with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9219, double checking something and I should commit in a few minutes  
15:20 <tmortagne> but except for this nothing no  
15:20 <mflorea> ok, I'll look at the failing tests in the mean time  
15:21 <tmortagne> ok will move on test too when I committed  
15:23 <msmeria> has quit  
15:27 <tmortagne> mflorea: looking at failing plaform build  
15:27 <mflorea> tmortagne: it's just bad ci state  
15:27 <tmortagne> you sure ?  
15:27 <tmortagne> looks like real errors  
15:28 <mflorea> and for the quality job, it was a broken jar  
15:28 <tmortagne> ok  
15:28 <mflorea> I deleted rendering jars from the local maven repo on that agent and then the build passed  
15:28 <mflorea> since I couldn't reproduce the failure locally  
15:29 <mflorea> it was failing on the agent before deleting the jars  
15:29 <tmortagne> (was referring to quality build error)  
15:29 <mflorea> yes, me too  
15:30 <mflorea> I'm updating wysiwyg and ui tests re new hidden pages (some tests are looking for those pages)  
15:30 <tmortagne> yes that I understood but my part was not clear ;)  
15:30 <mflorea> :)  
15:30 <tmortagne> ok  
15:31 <tmortagne> the current quality build is going to have failing test because of X11 issue  
15:32 <tmortagne> restarting its job  
15:32 <mflorea> yes, probably  
15:32 <tmortagne> (there is already one failing test)  
15:33 <mflorea> lots of VNC issues..  
15:34 <mflorea> hmm, why is the blog home page hidden?  
15:42 <tmortagne> looks like Vincent seen this as a non content page  
15:43 <tmortagne> (which is true) but it's an entry point  
15:43 <mflorea> I'm not sure hiding the blog page is good, it brings some issues, I'll comment on the issue and on the devs thread  
15:43 <tmortagne> I agree that an user entry point page should not be hidden  
15:44 <tmortagne> does not make much sense  
15:44 <tmortagne> for me an hidden page you are not supposed to go to and are used by other pages  
15:51 <sburjan> @devs: on which project should I report an issue about translations . The translations keys exist in french, but are not used  
15:51 <tmortagne> sburjan: that's the translations of which module ?  
15:51 <sburjan> for annotations, but the keys are in oldcore  
15:51 <tmortagne> does not matter and most annotation key have been moved to annotation  
15:52 <sburjan> actually, it seems the keys are duplicated  
15:52 <tmortagne> annotations keys in oldcore are deprecated  
15:52 <evalica> has quit  
15:52 <sburjan> no, wait  
15:53 <sburjan> annotations keys are in 2 places  
15:53 <sburjan> 1) in annotation-ui module and also in oldcore  
15:53 <tmortagne> sburjan: yes that's what I keep telling you  
15:53 <tmortagne> the ones in oldcore are deprecated keys  
15:53 <tmortagne> they have been moved to annotation application  
15:53 <sburjan> depreacated means not taken into consideration ?  
15:54 <sburjan> ok, so I should create another issue so we move \_all\_ the keys from oldcore to annotations-ui  
15:54 <tmortagne> deprecated means deprecated, they still exist and you can still use them but they are not maintained and the right ones are the one in annotation application  
15:54 <tmortagne> no  
15:55 <sburjan> bassically my issue is this: I have 5 keys in oldcore which have french translation. But when I switch my XWiki to french, I don't get the french message  
15:55 <tmortagne> the fact that there is deprecated keys in oldcore is perfectly normal again, what may be wrong is that the translations have not been copied  
15:56 <sburjan> so what should I do ? shouldn't I report an issue stating that these 5 keys even if they have french translation are not taken into account ?  
15:56 <tmortagne> in any case if there is translation in oldcore there is no reason they are not used  
15:56 <tmortagne> if they are not used then it means the keys changed  
15:57 <tmortagne> if there was french translations you would get them  
15:57 <tmortagne> so I doubt that's the issue  
15:57 <sburjan> the keys did not changed. the code uses the right key which I am able to see it on github  
15:57 <sburjan> \*chage  
15:57 <tmortagne> it does not change anything that the translation are in oldcore or in annotations  
15:57 <sburjan> ok, then I am going to report a bug  
15:58 <sburjan> because we have the key, we have the translation, but the translation in french is not used. The english one is used instead  
15:58 <sburjan> don't you agree ?  
15:59 <tmortagne> sburjan: which translation key for example ?  
15:59 <sburjan> annotations.config.type.explanation  
15:59 <sburjan> check in core, we have a translation from this  
15:59 <sburjan> in french  
15:59 <tmortagne> where is this key used ?  
16:00 <sburjan> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/AnnotationCode/AnnotationConfigSheet?editor=wiki  
16:02 <sburjan> basically all the keys used by the $services.localization.render from this page do not work in french  
16:02 <sburjan> \*none of the keys  
16:03 <sburjan> are you able to reproduce ? I'm also on the latest snapshot  
16:04 <tmortagne> looks like localization module bug to me  
16:05 <sburjan> the thing is that the keys are not duplicated ...  
16:05 <sburjan> so I can't explain why is it not working  
16:05 <tmortagne> why do you say the key are not duplicated ?  
16:05 <tmortagne> they are in the default language  
16:05 <sburjan> at least these 5 keys I am talking about are not duplicated in both annotations-ui and oldcore  
16:05 <tmortagne> yes they are  
16:06 <tmortagne> I can find annotations.config.type.explanation in the default language of the Translations page  
16:07 <sburjan> indeed  
16:07 <sburjan> I was looking at the Translations\_fr :)  
16:07 <tmortagne> I guess the localization module fallback on the page default language before checking checking for all other translation sources  
16:08 <tmortagne> checking in debug  
16:08 <sburjan> so this means we have key duplication ... indeed.. for some reason the translations from annotations-ui take priority and the ones from oldcore are discarded  
16:08 <tmortagne> the key duplication is not an issue, what is an issue if that it's not properly supported  
16:10 <sburjan> yes, I remember that the translations from page take precedence over the one from JAR files, maybe this is why the ones from Translation page are used first.  
16:10 <sburjan> and the bug would be that the ones from oldcore are not checked anymore
